clinical_study.brief_title: Agreement Among Expert Radiologists in Diagnosing Primary Liver Tumors by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
clinical_study.official_title: Agreement Among Expert Radiologists in Diagnosing Primary Liver Tumors by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) in Non-Cirrhotic Patients - A Double Blind International Multicenter Study

collaborator.agency: The Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this multicenter study is to evaluate the agreement among expert radiologists in interpreting magnetic resonance images (MRI) assessing common primary liver tumours in non-cirrhotic patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) is currently the method of choice for non-invasive diagnosis of primary liver tumors. However, differentiation of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) from adenoma and focal nodular hyperplasia (FNH) remains challenging, particularly in non-cirrhotic patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Inter-observer agreement among expert radiologists in diagnosing primary liver tumors by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).
primary_outcome.description: Inter-observer agreement for categorical data will by assessed by the Fliess' kappa (good agreement >0.7).

secondary_outcome.measure: Agreement of radiologists with the actual diagnosis of primary liver tumors assessed by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).
secondary_outcome.description: The actual diagnosis is defined as the histopathology diagnosis of the resected liver specimen, the current gold standard technique. Such agreement will be assessed by Cohen's Kappa (good agreement >0.7).

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in radiologist' certainty of diagnosis (CoD) among different tumor types.
secondary_outcome.description: Radiologist' certainty of diagnosis (CoD) will be assessed by a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 1-10). Potential differences in CoD will be identified by non-parametric multiple comparisons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intra-class correlation coefficient among radiologists' Certainty of Diagnosis (CoD) in diagnosis primary liver tumors by Magnetic Resonant Imaging (MRI)
secondary_outcome.description: Intra-class correlation coefficient is a descriptive statistic that can be used when quantitative measurements are made on units that are organized into groups. It describes how strongly units in the same group resemble each other.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigate the diagnostic efficacy of radiologists' certainty of diagnosis (CoD) in accurately predicting primary liver tumors assessed by Magnetic Resonant Imaging (MRI)
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic efficacy will be assessed by Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) Curves.

arm_group.description: This single Cohort/Group will include all consecutive patients that received pre-operative Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) and underwent resection for primary liver tumors.

intervention.description: Hepatectomy with an intention to cure
intervention.other_name: Hepatectomy = liver resection by open surgery.

intervention.intervention_name: Histopathology diagnosis of resected liver specimen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histopathological diagnosis of Hepatocellular Cancer (HCC), Adenoma and/or Focular nodular hyperplasia (FNH).
- Patients that received a pre-operative Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).
- Patients that underwent liver resection with an intention to cure.
- Patient over 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other histopathological diagnosis such as cysts and hemangiomas.
- Patient age less than 18 years of age.
